• Difficulty	passing	urine.	You	
may need a catheter for 
one to two days.
• Infection. This is easily 
treated with antibiotics.
• Marks and bruises on 
your baby (risk of serious 
damage: less than 2 in 
1,000).  A ventouse can 
leave a suction mark and 
the forceps can bruise 
your baby’s face. These 
do not usually cause any 
problems and settle in one 
to two days.  Sometimes
